name: KELT-6
scenarioDescription:
The KELT-6 Exoplanetary System


Overview

KELT-6 is a star with 1.42 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.73 times its radius. It is located 790.57 light years away from the solar system.

KELT-6 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the KELT-6 system


KELT-6 c

KELT-6 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.39 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of KELT-6 c is 1179.78 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, KELT-6 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system KELT-6, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Multiple Observatories.
